job.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Insurance,Hospital & Health Care
job.description:
DevOps Engineer / Senior
DevOps Engineer
U.S. citizenship is required for this position due to Department of Defense restrictions*
Role Summary
This position can be filed at the Professional level or the Senior level. Part of a dynamic team, you will be responsible for the installation, upgrade, and support of enterprise Linux servers and applications. As WPS embraces DevSecOps, most of our Linux systems are automated through a continuous delivery pipeline. To be successful in this role, you must be passionate about infrastructure automation, DevSecOps and must love to help customers solve complex issues with automated solutions.
In This Role You Will
Use and develop WPS’ continuous delivery pipeline to build, deploy, patch and manage Linux servers and applications.
Help ensure security of WPS systems and data by automating compliance checks and standards through the CI/CD pipeline.
Learn all aspects of compliance on Linux based systems as you secure systems and participate in system audits.
Work with other team members and teams to facilitate adoption of DevSecOps processes.
Introduce, design, and implement new technologies to streamline business processes.
Work on automation of COTS deployment using CI/CD technology, and design & implement solutions based on design requirements.
This Role Could Be a Good Fit If You
Want to work on moderately complex projects independently or as part of a larger project team.
Can handle multiple competing initiatives and escalate issues effectively, efficiently and independently.
Are interested in working with technically adept team members that collaborate to solve complex problems.
Would thrive working with a leader that encourages autonomy, ideation and independence while maintaining strong team cohesion.
Have a passion for technology, process improvement, and a strong interest in innovation and automation.
Are experienced with configuration management concepts and infrastructure automation.
You have demonstrated experience in customer-focused solution development.
Are extremely detail oriented
You enjoy improving your own (and your teammates’) technical skills
You’ll Benefit From This Experience By
Providing technical assistance to clients both internal and external.
Working in an environment that will challenge you, and allow you to challenge others.
Working in an environment that serves our Nation’s military, veterans, Guard and Reserves along with their families.
You Need To Have
U.S. citizenship is required for this position due to Department of Defense restrictions.
Bachelor's Degree in related field or equivalent post high school and/or related work experience.
Senior Level: 1 year or more of related work experience.
We Highly Prefer
Senior level: - 4 or more years in information systems performing system administration.
Professional level: - 2 or more years in information systems performing system administration.
Strong grasp of the Linux platform, including understanding how the operating systems functions and package deployment methodology.
Strong programming and scripting skills in at least one of the following languages: Bash, Python, Java or Ruby.
Hands-on experience with at least one configuration/deployment management system, such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt or other similar tools.
Proficiency with version control system workflows, such as TFS, Git, Subversion, etc.
CI/CD pipeline development experience for software delivery using Jenkins, GitLab, Bamboo or similar tools.
Knowledge and hands-on experience with source code repository processes and tools, such as Artifactory.
We Also Prefer
Experience with ServiceNow or similar ticketing systems
Experience working in a highly secure environment
Puppet code testing with rspec or similar tools.
Experience with unit/system testing
Understanding of DISA, NIST, FISMA, DoD, and/or CMS audit requirements
Nice To Have
Experience with container management using OpenShift or Kubernetes.
Experience with working in cloud environments like AWS, Azure and Google.
This role is open to 100% remote work
Approved States:
Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, New Jersey, North Carolina, North Dakota, South Carolina, Texas, Virginia, Wisconsin
Your Team
You will be part of the DevOps - Linux and Core Infrastructure team, responsible for building and configuring the key technology components relied upon by WPS and all our business units. This is a small team, responsible for Linux, Unix, VMware, and server hardware. Two Senior and one Junior Linux Administrators will be your mentors. Our Sr. level individuals eventually will help train, coach, and support other team members (and other WPS teams) to write code that will manage infrastructure and application configurations.
Compensation And Benefits
Eligible for annual Performance Bonus Program
401(k) with dollar-per-dollar match up to 6% of salary
Competitive paid time off
Health and dental insurance start DAY 1
Vision insurance
Flexible spending, dependent care, and health savings accounts
Short- and long-term disability, group life insurance
Innovative professional and cognitive development programs

We are a world-class claims processor and program administrator for the government’s Medicare program. And we manage benefits for millions of active-duty and retired military personnel and their families.
